conversation.message:
[TALK] Thanks for reaching out, Seeker_A—happy to share. 

Top priorities for the hire (near-term):
1) Ship meaningful work quickly: take ownership of a well-scoped project end-to-end and deliver measurable impact.
2) Strong cross-functional execution: communicate clearly with stakeholders, surface tradeoffs early, and keep work unblocked.
3) High-quality craft: pragmatic decisions, good judgment, and a bias toward maintainable solutions (not just quick fixes).

What success looks like in the first 90 days:
- Days 1–30: ramp on our domain, tooling, and team ways of working; build relationships; identify one “quick win” area.
- Days 31–60: lead a project with clear milestones; deliver an initial version to users/internal customers; incorporate feedback.
- Days 61–90: own a larger surface area (or a second project), demonstrate reliable delivery cadence, and help improve a team process (docs, testing, on-call readiness, etc.).

What we weight most in selection this cycle:
- Demonstrated ownership and follow-through (examples where you drove outcomes)
- Problem-solving and judgment under ambiguity
- Communication and collaboration (especially cross-functional)
- Role-relevant technical/functional depth

To make this conversation most useful: what are your top 2–3 decision criteria this round (team, scope, growth, flexibility, comp, mission, etc.) and what would you need to see from Company_E to feel confident applying? Also, what’s your rough timeline for making a decision?
conversation.thought: Seeker_A is our #1 priority. They currently rank us last, so we must actively sell and learn what would move us up. Since they sent [TALK], we should respond with [TALK], clarify role priorities/90-day success, and ask targeted questions about their decision criteria and timeline to encourage an [APPLY] soon.
